title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.33 | 28-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ज्ञान तिमिरान दस्या ज्ञानान जनिशलाकया चक्षुरुन मीलितं येना तस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विश्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदांत स्वामिन नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानंदा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासाधी गौरवक्त वृंदा
हरे कृष्ण हरे कृष्ण कृष्ण कृष्ण हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा राम रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नारायनम नमस कृष्ट्या नरम चेवन अरोत्तमम देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासम ततो जयमुदी रयेत
In this session we will be discussing from the 33rd verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
प्रगायतस्व वीर्याणी तीर्थपाद प्रियश्रवाह आहूत इवमे शीग्रम दर्शनम याति चेतसी
The meaning of this verse is
The Supreme Lord Shri Krishna, whose glories and activities are pleasing to hear,
at once appears on the seat of my heart as if called for.
As soon as I begin to hear, I will be able to hear.
प्रगायतस्व वीर्याणी तीर्थपाद प्रियश्रवाह आहूत इवमे शीग्रम दर्शनम याति चेतसी
The Supreme Lord appears on the seat of his heart.
At once, as soon as he sings the glories,
as if Narad Muni is calling out for the Lord.
Like that, the Lord appears immediately.
You called me? Yes, I am here.
प्रगायतस्व वीर्याणी तीर्थपाद प्रियश्रवाह आहूत इवमे शीग्रम दर्शनम याति चेतसी
The very opening verse, it is said by Vyasadeva, the author of the Bhagavatam,
that I meditate upon Shri Krishna because he is the Absolute Truth.
सत्यं परं धीमही
सत्यं परं
सत्यं परं
सत्यं is truth.
परं there indicates Absolute Truth.
So what is this Absolute Truth?
Absolute Truth is Truth which is...
Truth in all phases of time.
Past, Present and Future.
The Truth is always the Truth.
It doesn't change.
Relative Truth is Truth which is not true in all phases of time.
Every Truth in the material world
of some material
object or material activity
is a Relative Truth.
If...
To give an example,
if I say
such and such a gentleman
is residing
in a particular apartment
or house.
Now this statement
is a Relative Truth.
truth because what happens with time in course of time that gentleman who's
staying in a particular house when he passes away when he changes body when he
dies then that statement such and such a gentleman residing in the house is no
longer true then we are to say he was residing and when he died he is no
longer residing in the house or even when he shifts from that residence due to
whatever reason to another residence then that statement such a gentleman is
residing in this house is no longer true so like this every statement we make
about a material phenomenon
in this world is a relative truth it is relative to time whereas the absolute
personality of Godhead Krishna is absolute truth he is always the Lord he
doesn't change his body he doesn't change his position his form his name
his form his name his form his name
his form his name his form his name
names his qualities his forms don't don't change you look at our own form
material body it changes they he knows when you thought they hey come on your
venom Jara anything material it is constantly undergoing change that's the
nature of material existence isn't it so
spiritual existence is not changing unchanging reality so unchanging
reality should not be mistaken to be something which is uninteresting in the
material world because inherently in anything material there is no Rasa
hmm therefore everything material is
actually without any substance it is without substance is without life
really speaking without any Vasu whereas spiritual existence is full of
Rasa
minute coworkers are how is it interesting if it is unchanging it is interesting because
spiritual existence is full of rasa even though unchanging how is it interesting it is
spirit is dynamic unlike matter matter is static spirit is dynamic
so spirit is always alive full of life life spirit is actually full of life
and that life never expires just like we say we understand from the Bhagavad Gita that this real
person inside this body the spirit soul does not die is always living but changes body the
body is something which is material is subject to deterioration and one day we have to quit this
body when it becomes old and useless
so spirit is dynamic spirit is full of life spirit is actually a full of Rasa
that is because the Supreme Lord personality of God at Krishna the absolute personality of God
at he is the ultimate reality ultimate person
the ultimate source from him everything is emanating
so he is full of Rasa he is full of life he is full of love he is full of activities
all of them are actually absolute all of them are absolute they are non-different from each other
so as soon as a pure devotee engages himself in the pure devotional service of hearing chanting
and remembering the name fame and activities of the Lord a pure devotee is engaged always in
devotional service what does devotional service consist of nine different
kinds of activities shravanam kirtanam smaranam
paada sevanam archanam vandanam dasyam sakhyam atmaniveganam of which three are particularly
mentioned here the first three hearing chanting and remembering shravanam kirtanam smaranam
about what hearing about what or chanting or remembering what the name fame and activities of

that is the recommendation in the bhagavata shravanaam kirtanam Vishno smaranam paada

his creation his maintenance
destruction everything about him when we hear that or we chant about it or we remember them
at once the Supreme Lord becomes visible to the transcendental eyes of the pure devotee
this ordinary eyes we cannot see anything spiritual how do the pure devotees see they

you can watch that cricket match live through this arrangement of television
is it not same way there is something called a spiritual television
what is the spiritual television that when a devotee sings the lord's name or hears about the

immediately the lord appears in his heart like a spiritual television is switched on
he reflects himself on the mirror
of the heart by spiritual television and this is possible for anybody who is engaged in pure

possible for anyone who engages in pure devotional service of hearing or chanting or remembering
therefore a pure devotee who is related
with the lord in loving transcendental service can experience the presence of the lord at every moment
what is the nature of pure devotees they're always engaged in devotional service of the supreme lord
therefore they are always experiencing the presence of the lord every moment because as soon as they
sing or hear or do devotional service the lord is appearing on their heart
another thing sri la prabhupada explains is that
sri narada chants the glorification of the lord not only for his personal benefit
but he is doing it for the benefit of everyone especially in this material world
and even when they are not spiritual from the spiritual point of view
of the lord they are doing it with the intention of receiving the glory of the lord
there are also other ways of receiving the glory of the lord just by hearing the glory of the lord
simply by hearing the glories of the lord from pure devotees
even those who are not spiritually advanced
कि विकैन एक्सपीरियंस द प्रेसेंस आफ द लॉर्ड इन अवर हार्ड आज स्टॉप यह थैंक यू वेरी मच हरी कृष्ण
